reasoning: Parasitic CNS infection with incidence estimates of 3-10 per 100k in endemic areas (Latin America, Asia, Africa), much lower globally. Using global average estimate of ~3.5 per 100k person-years. High geographic variation due to transmission patterns linked to Taenia solium distribution.
source: Garcia HH et al. (2016). Neurocysticercosis: Updated concepts about an old disease. Lancet Neurol. 15(10):1025-1035
